messages.title: It's so close in South Wales Central!
messages.content: Under the proportional voting system approximately 7% is needed to elect a Green Assembly Member. The last time a similar voting system was used, Greens polled 6.4%. Labour 2nd Votes have never elected an AM for South Wales Central and are even less likely to this time - 70,000 Labour votes were wasted in 2007! Greens are currently polling at 11% (ITV Wales/YouGov 10/03/2011).

mentions.tacticalSituation: Approximately 7% is needed to elect a Green Assembly Member. In a previous election with a similar voting system Greens polled 6.4%. Labour 2nd votes have never elected an AM for South Wales Central; 70,000 Labour votes were wasted in 2007. Greens are currently polling at 11%.

endorsements.endorsement: "You have two ballot papers in May's Welsh Assembly elections. Greens are on the 2nd ballot paper where Jake Griffiths has a real chance of being elected. Vote Green and help make history again!"

images.caption: Make history again! - Vote Green Party for Wales on May 5th
